text: Thomas David Henshaw (1939 â€“ 23 March 2014) was a New Zealand cartoonist. He was known for his drawings of rural life in his "Jock" cartoons. His a career spanning over 40 years. His cartoons were published in the New Zealand Farmer for 34 years. Henshaw was born in Kimbolton, New Zealand. He died on 23 March 2014 in Tamahere, New Zealand, aged 74. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Cartoonists Category:New Zealand artists Category:People from North Island
title: David Henshaw
